Processor.name: LPC13Uxx
Processor.description: LPC1315/16/17/35/36/37 Cortex-M3 MCU; up to 64 kB flash; up to 12 kB SRAM; USB device; USART; EEPROM

Register.name: CONSET
Register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AA
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

BitField.name: SI
BitField.description: I2C interrupt flag.

BitField.name: STO
BitField.description: STOP flag.

BitField.name: STA
BitField.description: START flag.

BitField.name: I2EN
BitField.description: I2C interface enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

BitField.name: Status
BitField.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I2C interface.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAT
Register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR0
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLH
Register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLL
Register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. I2nSCLL and I2nSCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CONCLR
Register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AAC
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

BitField.name: SIC
BitField.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: STAC
BitField.description: START flag Clear bit.

BitField.name: I2ENC
BitField.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MM_ENA
BitField.description: Monitor mode enable.

Enum.name: THE_I2C_MODULE_WILL_
Enum.description: The I2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I 2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

BitField.name: ENA_SCL
BitField.description: SCL output enable.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

BitField.name: MATCH_ALL
BitField.description: Select interrupt register match.

Enum.name: MATCH
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

Enum.name: ANYADDRESS
Enum.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

Register.name: ADR1
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR2
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR3
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DATA_BUFFER
Register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the I2DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MASK0
Register.description: I2C Slave address mask register. This mask register is associated with I2ADR0 to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is undefined.

Register.name: MASK1
Register.description: I2C Slave address mask register. This mask register is associated with I2ADR0 to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is undefined.

Register.name: MASK2
Register.description: I2C Slave address mask register. This mask register is associated with I2ADR0 to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is undefined.

Register.name: MASK3
Register.description: I2C Slave address mask register. This mask register is associated with I2ADR0 to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is undefined.

Register.name: MOD
Register.description: Watchdog mode register. This register contains the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

BitField.name: WDEN
BitField.description: Watchdog enable bit. Once this bit has been written with a 1 it cannot be rewritten with a 0.

BitField.name: WDRESET
BitField.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. Once this bit has been written with a 1 it cannot be rewritten with a 0.

Enum.name: INTERRUPT
Enum.description: A watchdog timeout will not cause a chip reset.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: A watchdog timeout will cause a chip reset.

BitField.name: WDTOF
BitField.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, by a feed error, or by events associated with WDPROTECT. Cleared by software. Causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1.

BitField.name: WDINT
BitField.description: Warning interrupt flag. Set when the timer reaches the value in WDWARNINT. Cleared by software.

BitField.name: WDPROTECT
BitField.description: Watchdog update mode. This bit can be set once by software and is only cleared by a reset.

Enum.name: NOT_LOCKED
Enum.description: The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed at any time.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed only after the counter is below the value of WDWARNINT and WDWINDOW.

BitField.name: LOCK
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit prevents disabling or powering down the clock source selected by bit 0 of the WDCLKSRC register and also prevents switching to a clock source that is disabled or powered down. This bit can be set once by software and is only cleared by any reset. If this bit is one and the WWDT clock source is the IRC when Deep-sleep or Power-down modes are entered, the IRC remains running thereby increasing power consumption in Deep-sleep mode and potentially preventing the part of entering Power-down mode correctly (see Section 15.7).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Watchdog timer constant register. This 24-bit register determines the time-out value.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Watchdog time-out value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FEED
Register.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in WDTC.

BitField.name: FEED
BitField.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TV
Register.description: Watchdog timer value register. This 24-bit register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Counter timer value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CLKSEL
BitField.description: Selects source of WDT clock

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: LOCK
BitField.description: If this bit is set to one writing to this register does not affect bit 0. The clock source can only be changed by first clearing this bit, then writing the new value of bit 0.

BitField.name: WARNINT
BitField.description: Watchdog warning interrupt compare value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: WINDOW
BitField.description: Watchdog window value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: MR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

BitField.name: MR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

BitField.name: MR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

BitField.name: MR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

BitField.name: CR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

BitField.name: CR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: Counter enable.

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_COUNTER_AN
Enum.description: The Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting.

BitField.name: CRST
BitField.description: Counter reset.

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_COUNTER_AN
Enum.description: The Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter. The 16-bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (below) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

BitField.name: PCVAL
BitField.description: Prescale value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter. The 16-bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

BitField.name: MR0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR0R
BitField.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

BitField.name: MR0S
BitField.description: Stop on MR0: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR1: an interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR1R
BitField.description: Reset on MR1: the TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

BitField.name: MR1S
BitField.description: Stop on MR1: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR2I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR2: an interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR2R
BitField.description: Reset on MR2: the TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

BitField.name: MR2S
BitField.description: Stop on MR2: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR3I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR3: an interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR3R
BitField.description: Reset on MR3: the TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

BitField.name: MR3S
BitField.description: Stop on MR3: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MR0
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR1
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR2
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR3
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: CCR
Register.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

BitField.name: CAP0RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B0_CAP0 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT16B0_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B0_CAP0 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT16B0_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT16B0_CAP0 event: a CR0 load due to a CT16B0_CAP0 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CAP1RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B0_CAP1 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT16B0_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC. This bit is reserved for 16-bit timer1 CT16B1.

BitField.name: CAP1FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B0_CAP1 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT16B0_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC. This bit is reserved for 16-bit timer1 CT16B1.

BitField.name: CAP1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT16B0_CAP1 event: a CR1 load due to a CT16B0_CAP1 event will generate an interrupt. This bit is reserved for 16-bit timer1 CT16B1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT16B0_CAP0 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Capture Register 1. CR1 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT16B0_CAP1 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[1:0] and CT16B1_MAT[1:0].

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of match channel 2. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output.

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output of match channel 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output.

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0. Table 296 shows the encoding of these bits.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT0 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT0 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC1
BitField.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT1 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT1 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC2
BitField.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT2 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT2 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC3
BitField.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT3 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT3 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTM
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin or comparator output is sampled for clocking. Values 0x1 and 0x3 are reserved.

BitField.name: ENCC
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

BitField.name: SELCC
BitField.description: Edge select. When bit 4 is 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x2 to 0x3 and 0x6 to 0x7 are reserved.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT16B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT16B0_CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT16
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT16B0_CCAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT16B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT16B0_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT16
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT16B0_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PWMC
Register.description: PWM Control Register. The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[1:0] and CT16B1_MAT[1:0].

BitField.name: PWMEN0
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel0.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT0.

BitField.name: PWMEN1
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel1.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT1.

BitField.name: PWMEN2
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel2.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT2.

BitField.name: PWMEN3
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel3.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT3.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: MR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

BitField.name: MR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

BitField.name: MR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

BitField.name: MR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

BitField.name: CR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

BitField.name: CR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: Counter enable.

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_COUNTER_AN
Enum.description: The Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting.

BitField.name: CRST
BitField.description: Counter reset.

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_COUNTER_AN
Enum.description: The Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter. The 16-bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (below) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

BitField.name: PCVAL
BitField.description: Prescale value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter. The 16-bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

BitField.name: MR0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR0R
BitField.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

BitField.name: MR0S
BitField.description: Stop on MR0: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR1: an interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR1R
BitField.description: Reset on MR1: the TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

BitField.name: MR1S
BitField.description: Stop on MR1: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR2I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR2: an interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR2R
BitField.description: Reset on MR2: the TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

BitField.name: MR2S
BitField.description: Stop on MR2: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR3I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR3: an interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR3R
BitField.description: Reset on MR3: the TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

BitField.name: MR3S
BitField.description: Stop on MR3: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MR0
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR1
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR2
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR3
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: CCR
Register.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

BitField.name: CAP0RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B1_CAP0 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT16B1_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B11_CAP0 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT16B1_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT16B1_CAP0 event: a CR0 load due to a CT16B1_CAP0 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CAP1RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B1_CAP1 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT16B1_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT16B1_CAP1 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT16B1_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT16B1_CAP1 event: a CR1 load due to a CT16B0_CAP1 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT16B0_CAP0 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Capture Register 1. CR1 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT16B1_CAP1 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[1:0] and CT16B1_MAT[1:0].

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of match channel 2. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output.

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output of match channel 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output.

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0. Table 296 shows the encoding of these bits.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT0 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT0 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC1
BitField.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT1 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT1 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC2
BitField.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT2 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT2 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC3
BitField.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MAT3 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MAT3 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTM
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin or comparator output is sampled for clocking. Values 0x2 to 0x3 are reserved.

BitField.name: ENCC
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

BitField.name: SELCC
BitField.description: When bit 4 is a 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x6 to 0x7 are reserved.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT16B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT16B1_CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT16
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT16B1_CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT16B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT16B1_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT16
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT16B1_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PWMC
Register.description: PWM Control Register. The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[1:0] and CT16B1_MAT[1:0].

BitField.name: PWMEN0
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel0.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT0.

BitField.name: PWMEN1
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel1.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT1.

BitField.name: PWMEN2
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel2.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT2.

BitField.name: PWMEN3
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel3.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT3.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins CT32Bn_MAT[3:0].

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT0/CT32B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT1/CT32B1_MAT1 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT2, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT2/CT32B1_MAT2 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT3, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B3_MAT0/CT32B1_MAT3 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.
