Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTM
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin or comparator output is sampled for clocking. If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000. Values 0x1 and0x3 are reserved.

BitField.name: ENCC
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

BitField.name: SElCC
BitField.description: When bit 4 is a 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x2 to 0x3 and 0x6 to 0x7 are reserved.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT32B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT32B0_CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT32
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT32B0_CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT32B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT32B0_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT32
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT32B0_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PWMC
Register.description: PWM Control Register. The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT32Bn_MAT[3:0].

BitField.name: PWMEN0
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel0.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT0.

BitField.name: PWMEN1
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel1.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT1.

BitField.name: PWMEN2
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel2.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT2.

BitField.name: PWMEN3
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel3. Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT132Bn_MAT3.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: MR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

BitField.name: MR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

BitField.name: MR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

BitField.name: MR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

BitField.name: CR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

BitField.name: CR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: Counter enable.

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_COUNTER_AN
Enum.description: The Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting.

BitField.name: CRST
BitField.description: Counter reset.

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_COUNTER_AN
Enum.description: The Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter. The 32-bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (below) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

BitField.name: PCVAL
BitField.description: Prescaler value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter. The 32-bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

BitField.name: MR0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR0R
BitField.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

BitField.name: MR0S
BitField.description: Stop on MR0: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR1: an interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR1R
BitField.description: Reset on MR1: the TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

BitField.name: MR1S
BitField.description: Stop on MR1: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR2I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR2: an interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR2R
BitField.description: Reset on MR2: the TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

BitField.name: MR2S
BitField.description: Stop on MR2: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR3I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR3: an interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR3R
BitField.description: Reset on MR3: the TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

BitField.name: MR3S
BitField.description: Stop on MR3: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MR0
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR1
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR2
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR3
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: CCR
Register.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

BitField.name: CAP0RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32B1_CAP0 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT32B1_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32B1_CAP0 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT32B1_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT32B1_CAP0 event: a CR0 load due to a CT32B1_CAP0 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CAP1RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32B1_CAP1 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT32B1_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32B1_CAP1 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT32B1_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT32B1_CAP1 event: a CR1 load due to a CT32B1_CAP1 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT32B0_CAP0 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Capture Register 1. CR1 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT32B1_CAP1 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins CT32Bn_MAT[3:0].

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT0/CT32B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT1/CT32B1_MAT1 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT2, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT2/CT32B1_MAT2 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT3, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B3_MAT0/CT32B1_MAT3 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bi_MAT0 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bi_MAT0 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC1
BitField.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bi_MAT1 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bi_MAT1 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC2
BitField.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bi_MAT2 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bi_MAT2 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC3
BitField.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bi_MAT3 pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bi_MAT3 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTM
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin or comparator output is sampled for clocking. If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000. Values 0x2 to 0x3 are reserved.

BitField.name: ENCC
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

BitField.name: SElCC
BitField.description: When bit 4 is a 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x3 to 0x7 are reserved.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT32B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT32B1_CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT32
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT32B1_CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CT32B
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CT32B1_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CT32
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CT32B1_CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PWMC
Register.description: PWM Control Register. The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT32Bn_MAT[3:0].

BitField.name: PWMEN0
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel0.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT0.

BitField.name: PWMEN1
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel1.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT1.

BitField.name: PWMEN2
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel2.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT2.

BitField.name: PWMEN3
BitField.description: PWM mode enable for channel3. Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT132Bn_MAT3.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RBR
Register.description: Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read. (DLAB=0)

BitField.name: RBR
BitField.description: The USART Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the USART RX FIFO.

Register.name: THR
Register.description: Transmit Holding Register. The next character to be transmitted is written here. (DLAB=0)

BitField.name: THR
BitField.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the USART transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it is the oldest byte in the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

Register.name: DLL
Register.description: Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. (DLAB=1)

BitField.name: DLLSB
BitField.description: The USART Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the DLM register, determines the baud rate of the USART.

Register.name: DLM
Register.description: Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. (DLAB=1)

BitField.name: DLMSB
BitField.description: The USART Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the DLL register, determines the baud rate of the USART.

Register.name: IER
Register.description: Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential USART interrupts. (DLAB=0)

BitField.name: RBRINTEN
BitField.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: THREINTEN
BitField.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[5].

BitField.name: RLSINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the Receive Line Status interrupt. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[4:1].

BitField.name: MSINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the Modem Status interrupt. The components of this interrupt can be read from the MSR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: ABEOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

BitField.name: ABTOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the auto-baud time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IIR
Register.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

BitField.name: INTSTATUS
BitField.description: Interrupt status. Note that IIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating IIR[3:1].

Enum.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_INTERRU
Enum.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: Interrupt identification. IER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the USART Rx FIFO. All other values of IER[3:1] not listed below are reserved.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: FIFOEN
BitField.description: These bits are equivalent to FCR[0].

BitField.name: ABEOINT
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: ABTOINT
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FCR
Register.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls USART FIFO usage and modes.

BitField.name: FIFOEN
BitField.description: FIFO enable

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: USART FIFOs are disabled. Must not be used in the application.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Active high enable for both USART Rx and TX FIFOs and FCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper USART operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the USART FIFOs.

BitField.name: RXFIFORES
BitField.description: RX FIFO Reset

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT
Enum.description: No impact on either of USART FIFOs.

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[1] will clear all bytes in USART Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: TXFIFORES
BitField.description: TX FIFO Reset

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT
Enum.description: No impact on either of USART FIFOs.

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[2] will clear all bytes in USART TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXTL
BitField.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver USART FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt is activated.

Register.name: LCR
Register.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

BitField.name: WLS
BitField.description: Word Length Select

BitField.name: SBS
BitField.description: Stop Bit Select

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Enable

BitField.name: PS
BitField.description: Parity Select

Enum.name: ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O
Enum.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

Enum.name: EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_
Enum.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

BitField.name: BC
BitField.description: Break Control

Enum.name: ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI
Enum.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin USART TXD is forced to logic 0 when LCR[6] is active high.

BitField.name: DLAB
BitField.description: Divisor Latch Access Bit

BitField.name: DTRCTRL
BitField.description: Source for modem output pin DTR. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

BitField.name: RTSCTRL
BitField.description: Source for modem output pin RTS. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: LMS
BitField.description: Loopback Mode Select. The modem loopback mode provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing. Serial data from the transmitter is connected internally to serial input of the receiver. Input pin, RXD, has no effect on loopback and output pin, TXD is held in marking state. The DSR, CTS, DCD, and RI pins are ignored. Externally, DTR and RTS are set inactive. Internally, the upper four bits of the MSR are driven by the lower four bits of the MCR. This permits modem status interrupts to be generated in loopback mode by writing the lower four bits of MCR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RTSEN
BitField.description: RTS enable

BitField.name: CTSEN
BitField.description: CTS enable

Register.name: LSR
Register.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

BitField.name: RDR
BitField.description: Receiver Data Ready:LSR[0] is set when the RBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the USART RBR FIFO is empty.

BitField.name: OE
BitField.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[1]. LSR[1] is set when USART RSR has a new character assembled and the USART RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the USART RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the USART RSR will be lost.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the USART RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: FE
BitField.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on FCR0. Upon detection of a framing error, the RX will attempt to re-synchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the USART RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: BI
BitField.description: Break Interrupt. When RXD1 is held in the spacing state (all zeros) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXD1 goes to marking state (all ones). A LSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the USART RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: THRE
BitField.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty. THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty USART THR and is cleared on a THR write.

BitField.name: TEMT
BitField.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both THR and TSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the TSR or the THR contain valid data.

Enum.name: VALID_D
Enum.description: THR and/or the TSR contains valid data.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: THR and the TSR are empty.

BitField.name: RXFE
BitField.description: Error in RX FIFO. LSR[7] is set when a character with a RX error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the RBR. This bit is cleared when the LSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the USART FIFO.

Enum.name: NO_ERROR
Enum.description: RBR contains no USART RX errors or FCR[0]=0.

Enum.name: ERRO
Enum.description: USART RBR contains at least one USART RX error.

BitField.name: TXERR
BitField.description: Tx Error. In smart card T=0 operation, this bit is set when the smart card has NACKed a transmitted character, one more than the number of times indicated by the TXRETRY field.

BitField.name: DCTS
BitField.description: Delta CTS. Set upon state change of input CTS. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, CTS.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input, CTS.

BitField.name: DDSR
BitField.description: Delta DSR. Set upon state change of input DSR. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, DSR.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input, DSR.

BitField.name: TERI
BitField.description: Trailing Edge RI. Set upon low to high transition of input RI. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, RI.

BitField.name: DDCD
BitField.description: Delta DCD. Set upon state change of input DCD. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, DCD.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input, DCD.

BitField.name: CTS
BitField.description: Clear To Send State. Complement of input signal CTS. This bit is connected to MCR[1] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: DSR
BitField.description: Data Set Ready State. Complement of input signal DSR. This bit is connected to MCR[0] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: RI
BitField.description: Ring Indicator State. Complement of input RI. This bit is connected to MCR[2] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: DCD
BitField.description: Data Carrier Detect State. Complement of input DCD. This bit is connected to MCR[3] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCR
Register.description: Scratch Pad Register. Eight-bit temporary storage for software.

BitField.name: PAD
BitField.description: A readable, writable byte.

Register.name: ACR
Register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

Enum.name: AUTO_BAUD_START_AUT
Enum.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Auto-baud mode select bit.

BitField.name: AUTORESTART
BitField.description: Start mode

Enum.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
Enum.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next USART Rx falling edge)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: ABEOINTCLR
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write only accessible).

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: ABTOINTCLR
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write only accessible).

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ICR
Register.description: IrDA Control Register. Enables and configures the IrDA (remote control) mode.

BitField.name: IRDAEN
BitField.description: IrDA mode enable

Enum.name: IRDA_MODE_IS_DISABLE
Enum.description: IrDA mode is disabled, USARTn acts as a standard USART.

BitField.name: IRDAINV
BitField.description: Serial input inverter

Enum.name: INVERTED
Enum.description: The serial input is not inverted.

Enum.name: NOT_INVERTED
Enum.description: The serial input is inverted. This has no effect on the serial output.

BitField.name: FIXPULSEEN
BitField.description: IrDA fixed pulse width mode.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: IrDA fixed pulse width mode disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: IrDA fixed pulse width mode enabled.

BitField.name: PULSEDIV
BitField.description: Configures the pulse width when FixPulseEn = 1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FDR
Register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

BitField.name: DIVADDVAL
BitField.description: Baud rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud rate generator will not impact the USART baud rate.

BitField.name: MULVAL
BitField.description: Baud rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for USART to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud rate generator is used or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: OSR
Register.description: Oversampling Register. Controls the degree of oversampling during each bit time.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: OSFRAC
BitField.description: Fractional part of the oversampling ratio, in units of 1/8th of an input clock period. (001 = 0.125, ..., 111 = 0.875)

BitField.name: OSINT
BitField.description: Integer part of the oversampling ratio, minus 1. The reset values equate to the normal operating mode of 16 input clocks per bit time.

BitField.name: FDINT
BitField.description: In Smart Card mode, these bits act as a more-significant extension of the OSint field, allowing an oversampling ratio up to 2048 as required by ISO7816-3. In Smart Card mode, bits 14:4 should initially be set to 371, yielding an oversampling ratio of 372.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TER
Register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off USART transmitter for use with software flow control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software can clear this bit when it detects that the a hardware-handshaking TX-permit signal (CTS) has gone false, or with software handshaking, when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it detects that the TX-permit signal has gone true, or when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

BitField.name: HDEN
BitField.description: Half-duplex mode enable

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCICTRL
Register.description: Smart Card Interface Control register. Enables and configures the Smart Card Interface feature.

BitField.name: SCIEN
BitField.description: Smart Card Interface Enable.

Enum.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_HALF_DU
Enum.description: Asynchronous half duplex smart card interface is enabled.

BitField.name: NACKDIS
BitField.description: NACK response disable. Only applicable in T=0.

BitField.name: PROTSEL
BitField.description: Protocol selection as defined in the ISO7816-3 standard.

BitField.name: TXRETRY
BitField.description: When the protocol selection T bit (above) is 0, the field controls the maximum number of retransmissions that the USART will attempt if the remote device signals NACK. When NACK has occurred this number of times plus one, the Tx Error bit in the LSR is set, an interrupt is requested if enabled, and the USART is locked until the FIFO is cleared.

BitField.name: XTRAGUARD
BitField.description: When the protocol selection T bit (above) is 0, this field indicates the number of bit times (ETUs) by which the guard time after a character transmitted by the USART should exceed the nominal 2 bit times. 0xFF in this field may indicate that there is just a single bit after a character and 11 bit times/character

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RS485CTRL
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

BitField.name: NMMEN
BitField.description: NMM enable.

Enum.name: RS_485_EIA_485_NORMA
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

Enum.name: RS_485_EIA_485_NORMA
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte causes the USART to set the parity error and generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RXDIS
BitField.description: Receiver enable.

BitField.name: AADEN
BitField.description: AAD enable.

BitField.name: SEL
BitField.description: Select direction control pin

Enum.name: RTS
Enum.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin RTS is used for direction control.

Enum.name: DTR
Enum.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin DTR is used for direction control.

BitField.name: DCTRL
BitField.description: Auto direction control enable.

BitField.name: OINV
BitField.description: Polarity control. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the RTS (or DTR) pin.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

BitField.name: ADRMATCH
BitField.description: Contains the address match value.

BitField.name: DLY
BitField.description: Contains the direction control (RTS or DTR) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SYNC
BitField.description: Enables synchronous mode.

BitField.name: CSRC
BitField.description: Clock source select.

BitField.name: FES
BitField.description: Falling edge sampling.

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: RxD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: RxD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK

BitField.name: TSBYPASS
BitField.description: Transmit synchronization bypass in synchronous slave mode.

Enum.name: SYNC
Enum.description: The input clock is synchronized prior to being used in clock edge detection logic

Enum.name: NOSYNC
Enum.description: The input clock is not synchronized prior to being used in clock edge detection logic. This allows for a high er input clock rate at the expense of potential metastability.

BitField.name: CSCEN
BitField.description: Continuous master clock enable (used only when CSRC is 1)

Enum.name: SCLK_CYCLES_ONLY_WHE
Enum.description: SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on TxD

Enum.name: SCLK_RUNS_CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: SCLK runs continuously (characters can be received on RxD independently from transmission on TxD)

BitField.name: SSDIS
BitField.description: Start/stop bits

Enum.name: SEND_START_STOP
Enum.description: Send start and stop bits as in other modes.

BitField.name: CCCLR
BitField.description: Continuous clock clear

Enum.name: HARDWARE_CLEARS_CSCE
Enum.description: Hardware clears CSCEN after each character is received.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR
Register.description: A/D Control Register. The CR register must be written to select the operating mode before A/D conversion can occur.

BitField.name: SEL
BitField.description: Selects which of the AD7:0 pins is (are) to be sampled and converted. Bit 0 selects Pin AD0, bit 1 selects pin AD1,..., and bit 7 selects pin AD7. In software-controlled mode (BURST = 0), only one channel can be selected, i.e. only one of these bits should be 1. In hardware scan mode (BURST = 1), any numbers of channels can be selected, i.e any or all bits can be set to 1. If all bits are set to 0, channel 0 is selected automatically (SEL = 0x01).

BitField.name: CLKDIV
BitField.description: The main clock (PCLK_ADC) is divided by (this value plus one) to produce the clock for the A/D converter. The clock should be less than or equal to 15.5 MHz(12-bit mode) or 31 MHz (10-bit mode) in software-controlled mode (BURST bit = 0).. Typically, software should program the smallest value in this field that yields a clock of 15.5 MHz or slightly less, but in certain cases (such as a high-impedance analog source) a slower clock may be desirable.

BitField.name: BURST
BitField.description: Burst mode If BURST is set to 1, the ADGINTEN bit in the INTEN register (Table 327) must be set to 0.

Enum.name: SOFTWARE_CONTROLLED_
Enum.description: Software-controlled mode: Conversions are software-controlled and require 31 clocks.

Enum.name: HARDWARE_SCAN_MODE_
Enum.description: Hardware scan mode: The AD converter does repeated conversions at the rate selected by the CLKS field, scanning (if necessary) through the pins selected by ones in the SEL field. The first conversion after the start corresponds to the least-significant bit set to 1 in the SEL field, then the next higher bits (pins) set to one are scanned if applicable. Repeated conversions can be terminated by clearing this bit, but the conversion in progress when this bit is cleared will be completed. Important: START bits must be 000 when BURST = 1, or conversions will not start.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: LPWRMODE
BitField.description: Low-power mode

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_LOW_POWE
Enum.description: Disable the low-power ADC mode. The analog circuitry remains activated when no conversions are requested.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_LOW_POWER
Enum.description: Enable the low-power ADC mode. The analog circuitry is automatically powered-down when no conversions are taking place. When any (hardware or software) triggering event is detected, the analog circuitry is enabled. After the required start-up time, the requested conversion will be launched. Once the conversion completes, the analog-circuitry will again be powered-down provided no further conversions are pending. This mode will NOT power-up the A/D if the ADC is powered down (ADC_PD bit in the PDRUNCFG register is HIGH) or if the part is in Deep-sleep, Power-down, or Deep power-down mode.

BitField.name: MODE10BIT
BitField.description: 10-bit conversion rate mode

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_10_BIT_CO
Enum.description: Enable the 10-bit conversion rate mode with high conversion rate.The A/D resolution is reduced to 10 bits (the two LSB of the conversion result will be forced to 0). The clock rate (set via the CLKDIV field) can be doubled to up to 31 MHz to achieve a conversion rate of up to one million samples per second.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: When the BURST bit is 0, these bits control whether and when an A/D conversion is started:

Enum.name: NO_START_THIS_VALUE
Enum.description: No start (this value should be used when clearing PDN to 0).

Enum.name: PIO0_2
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on PIO0_2/SSEL/CT16B0_CAP0.

Enum.name: PIO1_5
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on PIO1_5/DIR/CT32B0_CAP0.

Enum.name: CT32B0_MAT0
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT32B0_MAT0[1].

Enum.name: CT32B0_MAT1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT32B0_MAT1[1].

Enum.name: CT16B0_MAT0
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT16B0_MAT0[1].

Enum.name: CT16B0_MAT1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT16B0_MAT1[1].

BitField.name: EDGE
BitField.description: Edge control. This bit is significant only when the START field contains 010-111.

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Start conversion on a rising edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: Start conversion on a falling edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: GDR
Register.description: A/D Global Data Register. Contains the result of the most recent A/D conversion.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeros.

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin selected by the SEL field, divided by the voltage on the VDD pin or as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VSS/VREFN, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on ADn was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VDD/VREFP.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeros.

BitField.name: CHN
BitField.description: These bits contain the channel from which the result bits V_VREF were converted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeros.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read and when the ADCR is written. If the ADCR is written while a conversion is still in progress, this bit is set and a new conversion is started.

Register.name: INTEN
Register.description: A/D Interrupt Enable Register. This register contains enable bits that allow the DONE flag of each A/D channel to be included or excluded from contributing to the generation of an A/D interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN
BitField.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

BitField.name: ADGINTEN
BitField.description: When 1, enables the global DONE flag in ADDR to generate an interrupt. When 0, only the individual A/D channels enabled by ADINTEN 7:0 will generate interrupts. This bit must be set to 0 in burst mode (BURST = 1 in the CR register).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Unused, always 0.

Register.name: DR[0]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: DR[1]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: DR[2]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: DR[3]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: DR[4]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: DR[5]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: DR[6]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: DR[7]
Register.description: A/D Channel N Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin as it falls within the range of VREFP to VREFN. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREFN/VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP/VDD.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: A/D Status Register. This register contains DONE and OVERRUN flags for all of the A/D channels, as well as the A/D interrupt flag.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: These bits mirror the DONE status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel n.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: These bits mirror the OVERRRUN status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel n. Reading ADSTAT allows checking the status of all A/D channels simultaneously.

BitField.name: ADINT
BitField.description: This bit is the A/D interrupt flag. It is one when any of the individual A/D channel Done flags is asserted and enabled to contribute to the A/D interrupt via the ADINTEN register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Unused, always 0.

BitField.name: ADCOFFS
BitField.description: Offset trim bits for ADC operation. Initialized by the boot code. Can be overwritten by the user.

BitField.name: TRIM
BitField.description: Written-to by boot code. Can not be overwritten by the user. These bits are locked after boot code write.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PM
BitField.description: Power mode

Enum.name: DEFAULT
Enum.description: Default. The part is in active or sleep mode.

Enum.name: DEEPSLEEP
Enum.description: ARM WFI will enter Deep-sleep mode.

Enum.name: POWERDOWN
Enum.description: ARM WFI will enter Power-down mode.

Enum.name: DEEPPOWERDOWN
Enum.description: ARM WFI will enter Deep-power down mode (ARM Cortex-M0 core powered-down).

BitField.name: NODPD
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit prevents entry to Deep power-down mode when 0x3 is written to the PM field above, the SLEEPDEEP bit is set, and a WFI is executed. Execution continues after the WFI if this bit is 1. This bit is cleared only by power-on reset, so writing a one to this bit locks the part in a mode in which Deep power-down mode is blocked.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

BitField.name: SLEEPFLAG
BitField.description: Sleep mode flag

Enum.name: NOPOWERDOWN
Enum.description: Read: No power-down mode entered. LPC11U1x is in Active mode. Write: No effect.

Enum.name: POWERDOWN
Enum.description: Read: Sleep/Deep-sleep or Deep power-down mode entered. Write: Writing a 1 clears the SLEEPFLAG bit to 0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

BitField.name: DPDFLAG
BitField.description: Deep power-down flag

Enum.name: DPNOTENTERED
Enum.description: Read: Deep power-down mode not entered. Write: No effect.

Enum.name: DPENTERED
Enum.description: Read: Deep power-down mode entered. Write: Clear the Deep power-down flag.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

BitField.name: GPDATA
BitField.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

BitField.name: GPDATA
BitField.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

BitField.name: GPDATA
BitField.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

BitField.name: GPDATA
BitField.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

BitField.name: WAKEUPHYS
BitField.description: WAKEUP pin hysteresis enable

BitField.name: GPDATA
BitField.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

BitField.name: STARTA
BitField.description: BIST start address: Bit 0 is fixed zero since only even addresses are allowed.

BitField.name: STOPA
BitField.description: BIST stop address: Bit 0 is fixed zero since only even addresses are allowed.

BitField.name: DEVSEL
BitField.description: BIST device select bit 0: the BIST signature is generated over the total memory space. Singe pages are interleaved over the EEPROM devices when multiple devices are used, the signature is generated over memory of multiple devices. 1: the BIST signature is generated only over a memory range located on a single EEPROM device. Therefore the internal address generation is done such that the address' CS bits are kept stable to select only the same device. The address' MSB and LSB bits are used to step through the memory range specified by the start and stop address fields. Note: if this bit is set the start and stop address fields must be programmed such that they both address the same EEPROM device. Therefore the address' CS bits in both the start and stop address must be the same.

BitField.name: STRTBIST
BitField.description: BIST start bit Setting this bit will start the BIST. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: DATA_SIG
BitField.description: BIST 16-bit signature calculated from only the data bytes

BitField.name: PARITY_SIG
BitField.description: BIST 16-bit signature calculated from only the parity bits of the data bytes

Register.name: FLASHCFG
Register.description: Flash memory access time configuration register

BitField.name: FLASHTIM
BitField.description: Flash memory access time. FLASHTIM +1 is equal to the number of system clocks used for flash access.

Enum.name: 1_SYSTEM_CLOCK_FLASH
Enum.description: 1 system clock flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 20 MHz).

Enum.name: 2_SYSTEM_CLOCKS_FLAS
Enum.description: 2 system clocks flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 40 MHz).

Enum.name: 3_SYSTEM_CLOCKS_FLAS
Enum.description: 3 system clocks flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 50 MHz).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software must not change the value of these bits. Bits 31:2 must be written back exactly as read.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Signature generation start address (corresponds to AHB byte address bits[20:4]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: BIST stop address divided by 16 (corresponds to AHB byte address [20:4]).

BitField.name: SIG_START
BitField.description: Start control bit for signature generation.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SW0_31_0
BitField.description: Word 0 of 128-bit signature (bits 31 to 0).

BitField.name: SW1_63_32
BitField.description: Word 1 of 128-bit signature (bits 63 to 32).

BitField.name: SW2_95_64
BitField.description: Word 2 of 128-bit signature (bits 95 to 64).

BitField.name: SW3_127_96
BitField.description: Word 3 of 128-bit signature (bits 127 to 96).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SIG_DONE
BitField.description: When 1, a previously started signature generation has completed. See FMSTATCLR register description for clearing this flag.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SIG_DONE_CLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bits clears the signature generation completion flag (SIG_DONE) in the FMSTAT register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Control Register 0. Selects the serial clock rate, bus type, and data size.

BitField.name: DSS
BitField.description: Data Size Select. This field controls the number of bits transferred in each frame. Values 0000-0010 are not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: FRF
BitField.description: Frame Format.

Enum.name: RESERVED
Enum.description: This combination is not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: CPOL
BitField.description: Clock Out Polarity. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

BitField.name: CPHA
BitField.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: FIRSTCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

Enum.name: SECONDCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

BitField.name: SCR
BitField.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

BitField.name: LBM
BitField.description: Loop Back Mode.

Enum.name: SERIAL_INPUT_IS_TAKE
Enum.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

BitField.name: SSE
BitField.description: SPI Enable.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The SPI controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SSP/SPI registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

BitField.name: MS
BitField.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

Enum.name: MASTER
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

Enum.name: SLAVE
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

BitField.name: SOD
BitField.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SPI controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DR
Register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SPI controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bit, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SPI controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bit, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

BitField.name: TNF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RNE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

BitField.name: BSY
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SPI controller is idle, 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CPSDVSR
BitField.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which SPI_PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

Register.name: IMSC
Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RTMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: TXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

BitField.name: RTIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read for a timeout period interrupt. The timeout period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function. Values 0x2 to 0x7 are reserved.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Selects function mode (on-chip pull-up/pull-down resistor control).

BitField.name: INV
BitField.description: Invert input

Enum.name: INPUT_NOT_INVERTED_
Enum.description: Input not inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 1, LOW on pin reads as 0).

Enum.name: INPUT_INVERTED_HIGH
Enum.description: Input inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 0, LOW on pin reads as 1).

BitField.name: OD
BitField.description: Open-drain mode.

Enum.name: OPEN_DRAIN_MODE_ENAB
Enum.description: Open-drain mode enabled. This is not a true open-drain mode. Input cannot be pulled up above VDD.

Enum.name: USER_FLASH_MODE_INT

Enum.name: LEVEL_2_THE_INTERRU
Enum.description: Level 2: The interrupt assertion threshold voltage is 2.52 V; the interrupt de-assertion threshold voltage is 2.66 V.

Enum.name: LEVEL_3_THE_INTERRU

BitField.name: RDET0
BitField.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No rising edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a rising edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear rising edge detection for this pin.

BitField.name: PSTAT0
BitField.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the PINTENT_F register).

Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the PINTENT_F register).
