Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Control Register 0. Selects the serial clock rate, bus type, and data size.

BitField.name: DSS
BitField.description: Data Size Select. This field controls the number of bits transferred in each frame. Values 0000-0010 are not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: FRF
BitField.description: Frame Format.

Enum.name: RESERVED
Enum.description: This combination is not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: CPOL
BitField.description: Clock Out Polarity. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

BitField.name: CPHA
BitField.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: FIRSTCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

Enum.name: SECONDCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

BitField.name: SCR
BitField.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

BitField.name: LBM
BitField.description: Loop Back Mode.

Enum.name: SERIAL_INPUT_IS_TAKE
Enum.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

BitField.name: SSE
BitField.description: SPI Enable.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The SPI controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SSP/SPI registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

BitField.name: MS
BitField.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

Enum.name: MASTER
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

Enum.name: SLAVE
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

BitField.name: SOD
BitField.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SPI controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DR
Register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SPI controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bit, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SPI controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bit, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

BitField.name: TNF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RNE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

BitField.name: BSY
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SPI controller is idle, 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CPSDVSR
BitField.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which SPI_PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

Register.name: IMSC
Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RTMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: TXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

BitField.name: RTIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read for a timeout period interrupt. The timeout period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: INT
BitField.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

BitField.name: COMB
BitField.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

Enum.name: OR_FUNCTIONALITY_A_
Enum.description: OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

Enum.name: AND_FUNCTIONALITY_A
Enum.description: AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

BitField.name: TRIG
BitField.description: Group interrupt trigger

Register.name: PORT_POL0
Register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

BitField.name: POL_0
BitField.description: Configure pin polarity of port pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin P0/1_n of port 0/1 . 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

BitField.description: Configure pin polarity of port 0/1 pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin P0/1_n of port 0/1. 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

BitField.name: ENA_0

BitField.name: INT
BitField.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

BitField.name: COMB
BitField.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

Enum.name: OR_FUNCTIONALITY_A_
Enum.description: OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

Enum.name: AND_FUNCTIONALITY_A
Enum.description: AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

BitField.name: TRIG
BitField.description: Group interrupt trigger

Register.name: PORT_POL0
Register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

BitField.name: POL_0
BitField.description: Configure pin polarity of port pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin P0/1_n of port 0/1 . 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

Register.name: COMPVAL
Register.description: Compare value LSB register. Holds the 32 LSBs of the compare value.

BitField.name: RICOMP
BitField.description: Compare register. Holds the 32 LSBs of the compare value which is compared to the counter.

Register.name: MASK
Register.description: Mask LSB register. This register holds the 32 LSB s of the mask value. A one written to any bit will force a compare on the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register.

BitField.name: RIMASK
BitField.description: Mask register. This register holds the 32 LSBs of the mask value. A one written to any bit overrides the result of the comparison for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register (causes the comparison of the register bits to be always true).

BitField.name: RITINT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag

Enum.name: MASK
Enum.description: This bit is set to 1 by hardware whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of RICOMPVAL and RIMASK registers. Writing a 1 to this bit will clear it to 0. Writing a 0 has no effect.

Enum.name: NO_MASK
Enum.description: The counter value does not equal the masked compare value.

BitField.name: RITENCLR
BitField.description: Timer enable clear

Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_O
Enum.description: The timer will be cleared to 0 whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of COMPVAL/COMPVAL_H and MASK/MASK_H registers. This will occur on the same clock that sets the interrupt flag.

Enum.name: NOT_CLEAR_ON_0
Enum.description: The timer will not be cleared to 0.

BitField.name: RITENBR
BitField.description: Timer enable for debug

Enum.name: HALT_ON_DEBUG
Enum.description: The timer is halted when the processor is halted for debugging.

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT_ON_DEBUG
Enum.description: Debug has no effect on the timer operation.

BitField.name: RITEN
BitField.description: Timer enable.

Enum.name: TIMER_ENABLED
Enum.description: Timer enabled. This can be overruled by a debug halt if enabled in bit 2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: COUNTER
Register.description: Counter LSB register. 32 LSBs of the counter.

BitField.name: RICOUNTER
BitField.description: 32 LSBs of the up counter. Counts continuously unless RITEN bit in CTRL register is cleared or debug mode is entered (if enabled by the RITNEBR bit in RICTRL). Can be loaded to any value in software.

Register.name: COMPVAL_H
Register.description: Compare value MSB register. Holds the 16 MSBs of the compare value.

BitField.name: RICOMP
BitField.description: Compare value MSB register. Holds the 16 MSBs of the compare value which is compared to the counter.

Register.name: MASK_H
Register.description: Mask MSB register. This register holds the 16 MSBs of the mask value. A one written to any bit will force a compare on the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register.

BitField.name: RIMASK
BitField.description: Mask register. This register holds the 16 MSBs of the mask value. A one written to any bit overrides the result of the comparison for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register (causes the comparison of the register bits to be always true).

Register.name: COUNTER_H
Register.description: Counter MSB register. 16 MSBs of the counter.

BitField.name: RICOUNTER
BitField.description: 16 LSBs of the up counter. Counts continuously unless RITEN bit in RICTRL register is cleared or debug mode is entered (if enabled by the RITNEBR bit in RICTRL). Can be loaded to any value in software.

BitField.name: DEV_ADDR
BitField.description: USB device address. After bus reset, the address is reset to 0x00. If the enable bit is set, the device will respond on packets for function address DEV_ADDR. When receiving a SetAddress Control Request from the USB host, software must program the new address before completing the status phase of the SetAddress Control Request.

BitField.name: DEV_EN
BitField.description: USB device enable. If this bit is set, the HW will start responding on packets for function address DEV_ADDR.

BitField.name: SETUP
BitField.description: SETUP token received. If a SETUP token is received and acknowledged by the device, this bit is set. As long as this bit is set all received IN and OUT tokens will be NAKed by HW. SW must clear this bit by writing a one. If this bit is zero, HW will handle the tokens to the CTRL EP0 as indicated by the CTRL EP0 IN and OUT data information programmed by SW.

BitField.name: PLL_ON
BitField.description: Always PLL Clock on:

Enum.name: USB_NEEDCLK_ALWAYS_1
Enum.description: USB_NeedClk always 1. Clock will not be stopped in case of suspend.

BitField.name: LPM_SUP
BitField.description: LPM Supported:

BitField.name: INTONNAK_AO
BitField.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk OUT EP

Enum.name: ACKNOW
Enum.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

Enum.name: ACKNOW_NAK
Enum.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

BitField.name: INTONNAK_AI
BitField.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk IN EP

Enum.name: ACKNOW
Enum.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

Enum.name: ACKNOW_NAK
Enum.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

BitField.name: INTONNAK_CO
BitField.description: Interrupt on NAK for control OUT EP

Enum.name: ACKNOW
Enum.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

Enum.name: ACKNOW_NAK
Enum.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

BitField.name: INTONNAK_CI
BitField.description: Interrupt on NAK for control IN EP

Enum.name: ACKNOW
Enum.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

Enum.name: ACKNOW_NAK
Enum.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

BitField.name: DCON
BitField.description: Device status - connect. The connect bit must be set by SW to indicate that the device must signal a connect. The pull-up resistor on USB_DP will be enabled when this bit is set and the VbusDebounced bit is one.

BitField.name: DSUS
BitField.description: Device status - suspend. The suspend bit indicates the current suspend state. It is set to 1 when the device hasn't seen any activity on its upstream port for more than 3 milliseconds. It is reset to 0 on any activity. When the device is suspended (Suspend bit DSUS = 1) and the software writes a 0 to it, the device will generate a remote wake-up. This will only happen when the device is connected (Connect bit = 1). When the device is not connected or not suspended, a writing a 0 has no effect. Writing a 1 never has an effect.

BitField.name: LPM_SUS
BitField.description: Device status - LPM Suspend. This bit represents the current LPM suspend state. It is set to 1 by HW when the device has acknowledged the LPM request from the USB host and the Token Retry Time of 10us has elapsed. When the device is in the LPM suspended state (LPM suspend bit = 1) and the software writes a zero to this bit, the device will generate a remote walk-up. Software can only write a zero to this bit when the LPM_REWP bit is set to 1. HW resets this bit when it receives a host initiated resume. HW only updates the LPM_SUS bit when the LPM_SUPP bit is equal to one.

BitField.name: LPM_REWP
BitField.description: LPM Remote Wake-up Enabled by USB host. HW sets this bit to one when the bRemoteWake bit in the LPM extended token is set to 1. HW will reset this bit to 0 when it receives the host initiated LPM resume, when a remote wake-up is sent by the device or when a USB bus reset is received. Software can use this bit to check if the remote wake-up feature is enabled by the host for the LPM transaction.

BitField.name: DCON_C
BitField.description: Device status - connect change. The Connect Change bit is set when the device's pull-up resistor is disconnected because VBus disappeared. The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: DSUS_C
BitField.description: Device status - suspend change. The suspend change bit is set to 1 when the suspend bit toggles. The suspend bit can toggle because: - The device goes in the suspended state - The device is disconnected - The device receives resume signaling on its upstream port. The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: DRES_C
BitField.description: Device status - reset change. This bit is set when the device received a bus reset. On a bus reset the device will automatically go to the default state (unconfigured and responding to address 0). The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: VBUSDEBOUNCED
BitField.description: This bit indicates if Vbus is detected or not. The bit raises immediately when Vbus becomes high. It drops to zero if Vbus is low for at least 3 ms. If this bit is high and the DCon bit is set, the HW will enable the pull-up resistor to signal a connect.

BitField.name: FRAME_NR
BitField.description: Frame number. This contains the frame number of the last successfully received SOF. In case no SOF was received by the device at the beginning of a frame, the frame number returned is that of the last successfully received SOF. In case the SOF frame number contained a CRC error, the frame number returned will be the corrupted frame number as received by the device.

BitField.name: ERR_CODE
BitField.description: The error code which last occurred:

Register.name: EPLISTSTART
Register.description: USB EP Command/Status List start address

BitField.name: EP_LIST
BitField.description: Start address of the USB EP Command/Status List.

BitField.name: DA_BUF
BitField.description: Start address of the buffer pointer page where all endpoint data buffers are located.

BitField.name: HIRD_HW
BitField.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - HW. This is the HIRD value from the last received LPM token

BitField.name: HIRD_SW
BitField.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - SW. This is the time duration required by the USB device system to come out of LPM initiated suspend after receiving the host initiated LPM resume.

BitField.name: DATA_PENDING
BitField.description: As long as this bit is set to one and LPM supported bit is set to one, HW will return a NYET handshake on every LPM token it receives. If LPM supported bit is set to one and this bit is zero, HW will return an ACK handshake on every LPM token it receives. If SW has still data pending and LPM is supported, it must set this bit to 1.

BitField.name: SKIP
BitField.description: Endpoint skip: Writing 1 to one of these bits, will indicate to HW that it must deactivate the buffer assigned to this endpoint and return control back to software. When HW has deactivated the endpoint, it will clear this bit, but it will not modify the EPINUSE bit. An interrupt will be generated when the Active bit goes from 1 to 0. Note: In case of double-buffering, HW will only clear the Active bit of the buffer indicated by the EPINUSE bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Fixed to zero because the control endpoint zero is fixed to single-buffering for each physical endpoint.

BitField.name: BUF
BitField.description: Buffer in use: This register has one bit per physical endpoint. 0: HW is accessing buffer 0. 1: HW is accessing buffer 1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Fixed to zero because the control endpoint zero is fixed to single-buffering for each physical endpoint.

BitField.name: BUF_SB
BitField.description: Buffer usage: This register has one bit per physical endpoint. 0: Single-buffer. 1: Double-buffer. If the bit is set to single-buffer (0), it will not toggle the corresponding EPINUSE bit when it clears the active bit. If the bit is set to double-buffer (1), HW will toggle the EPINUSE bit when it clears the Active bit for the buffer.

BitField.name: EP0OUT
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 OUT direction. This bit will be set if NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software or a SETUP packet is successfully received for the control EP0. If the IntOnNAK_CO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the Control EP0 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP0IN
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 IN direction. This bit will be set if NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_CI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the Control EP0 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP1OUT
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP1 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP1IN
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP1 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP2OUT
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP2 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP2IN
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP2 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP3OUT
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP3 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP3IN
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP3 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP4OUT
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP4 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP4IN
BitField.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP4 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: FRAME_INT
BitField.description: Frame interrupt. This bit is set to one every millisecond when the VbusDebounced bit and the DCON bit are set. This bit can be used by software when handling isochronous endpoints. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: DEV_INT
BitField.description: Device status interrupt. This bit is set by HW when one of the bits in the Device Status Change register are set. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

BitField.name: EP_INT_EN
BitField.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

BitField.name: FRAME_INT_EN
BitField.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

BitField.name: DEV_INT_EN
BitField.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

BitField.name: EP_SET_INT
BitField.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

BitField.name: FRAME_SET_INT
BitField.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

BitField.name: DEV_SET_INT
BitField.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

BitField.name: ROUTE_INT9_0
BitField.description: This bit can control on which hardware interrupt line the interrupt will be generated: 0: IRQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit 1: FIQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit

BitField.name: ROUTE_INT30
BitField.description: This bit can control on which hardware interrupt line the interrupt will be generated: 0: IRQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit 1: FIQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit

BitField.name: ROUTE_INT31
BitField.description: This bit can control on which hardware interrupt line the interrupt will be generated: 0: IRQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit 1: FIQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit

BitField.name: TOGGLE
BitField.description: Endpoint data toggle: This field indicates the current value of the data toggle for the corresponding endpoint.

Register.name: B[0]
Register.description: Byte pin registers port 0/1; pins PIO0/1_0 to PIO0/1_31

BitField.name: PBYTE
BitField.description: Read: state of the pin P0/1_n, regardless of direction, masking, or alternate function, except that pins configured as analog I/O always read as 0. Write: loads the pin's output bit.

BitField.name: PWORD
BitField.description: Read 0: pin is LOW. Write 0: clear output bit. Read 0xFFFF FFFF: pin is HIGH. Write any value 0x0000 0001 to 0xFFFF FFFF: set output bit. Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit.

BitField.name: MPORTP0
BitField.description: Masked port register (bit 0 = P0/1_0, bit 1 = P0/1_1, ..., bit 31 = P0/1_31). 0 = Read: pin is LOW and/or the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 1; write: clear output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0. 1 = Read: pin is HIGH and the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0; write: set output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0.

BitField.name: COUNTFLAG
BitField.description: Counter Flag

BitField.name: CLKSOURCE
BitField.description: Timer Clock Source

BitField.name: TICKINT
BitField.description: Tick Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable SysTick Timer

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: DISFOLD
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: IMPLEMENTER
BitField.description: Implementer Code

BitField.name: VARIANT
BitField.description: Variant Number

BitField.name: PARTNO
BitField.description: Part Number

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Revision Number

BitField.name: NMIPENDSET
BitField.description: NMI set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSVSET
BitField.description: PendSV set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSVCLR
BitField.description: PendSV clear-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSTSET
BitField.description: SysTick exception set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSTCLR
BitField.description: SysTick exception clear-pending bit

BitField.name: ISRPENDING
BitField.description: Interrupt pending flag

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

BitField.name: VECTACTIVE
BitField.description: Contains the active exception number

BitField.name: TBLOFF
BitField.description: Vector table base offset field

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: VECTKEY
BitField.description: Register key

BitField.name: ENDIANESS
BitField.description: Data endianness bit

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field

BitField.name: SYSRESETREQ
BitField.description: System reset request bit

BitField.name: SEVONPEND
BitField.description: Send event on pending bit

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Enables unaligned access traps

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

BitField.name: PRI_6
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 6 (UsageFault)

BitField.name: PRI_5
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 5 (BusFault)

BitField.name: PRI_4
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 4 (MemManage)

BitField.name: PRI_11
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 11 (SVCall)

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15 (SysTick)

BitField.name: PRI_14
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 14 (PendSV)

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: USGFAULTENA
BitField.description: UsageFault enable Bit

BitField.name: BUSFAULTENA
BitField.description: BusFault Enable Bit

BitField.name: MEMFAULTENA
BitField.description: MemManage Enable Bit

BitField.name: SVCALLPENDED
BitField.description: SVCall Pending Bit

BitField.name: BUSFAULTPENDED
BitField.description: BusFault Exception Pending Bit

BitField.name: MEMFAULTPENDED
BitField.description: MemManage Exception Pending Bit

BitField.name: USGFAULTPENDED
BitField.description: UsageFault Exception Pending Bit

BitField.name: SYSTICKACT
BitField.description: SysTick Exception Active Bit

BitField.name: PENDSVACT
BitField.description: PendSV Exception Active Bit

BitField.name: MONITORACT
BitField.description: Debug Monitor Active Bit

BitField.name: SVCALLACT
BitField.description: SVCall Active Bit

BitField.name: USGFAULTACT
BitField.description: UsageFault Exception Active Bit

BitField.name: BUSFAULTACT
BitField.description: BusFault Exception Active Bit

BitField.name: MEMFAULTACT
BitField.description: MemManage Exception Active Bit

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: DACCVIOL
BitField.description: Data access violation flag

BitField.name: IACCVIOL
BitField.description: Instruction access violation flag

BitField.name: BFARVALID
BitField.description: BusFault Address Register(BFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: IMPRECISERR
BitField.description: Imprecise data bus error

BitField.name: PRECISERR
BitField.description: Precise data bus error

BitField.name: IBUSERR
BitField.description: Instruction bus error

BitField.name: DIVBYZERO
BitField.description: Divide by zero UsageFault

BitField.name: UNALIGNED
BitField.description: Unaligned access UsageFault

BitField.name: NOCP
BitField.description: No coprocessor UsageFault

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: INVSTATE
BitField.description: Invalid state UsageFault

BitField.name: UNDEFINSTR
BitField.description: Undefined instruction UsageFault

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals
